page.title: 19The Village Policeman
page.content: Before 1967 there were no policemen in Mintlaw.The authorities closed Longside,St Fergus and Stuartfield and they took all the policemen into Mintlaw police station where there are now four constable.There is also one constable at Maud and one at New Deer. I transferred from Laurencekirk to Mintlaw in 1982.Mintlaw and its countryside is a law abiding place.I have never used my truncheon.The dogs are called by word of mouth.We charge people,in Mintlaw for reckless driving.I have never been hurt in the line of duty.We always wear uniform at Mintlaw while we are on duty,but other departments in Peterhead do not always were a uniform.We always carry a card for identification where ever we go.
